data.Title: Google Ruled a Monopoly in US Antitrust Case
data.Description: A US federal judge ruled that Google is a monopoly and has acted as one to maintain its dominance in the search market. The ruling could have significant implications for the company, potentially leading to limitations or a breakup.

data.Title: Apple Rejects Bing as Default Search Engine, Even With a Hefty Offer
data.Description: Apple has reportedly declined to replace Google with Microsoft Bing as the default search engine on iPhones, even when offered a significant financial incentive, including potentially the entire Microsoft company. Apple cites Bing's poor ad monetization and Google's superior revenue share as reasons for the decision.

data.Title: Google Ads to Transition Smart Campaigns to Performance Max
data.Description: Google Ads will be transitioning the functionality of Smart Campaigns into Performance Max campaigns over the coming months. Google claims that Performance Max offers all the benefits of Smart Campaigns and more.

data.Title: Google Business Profiles Performance Report No Longer Shows Call Data
data.Description: The Google Business Profiles performance report has removed the "call" tab, which provided data on calls generated from Google Search and Maps. This change might be related to the previously reported removal of Google Business Profile call history.

data.Title: Google Search Console Introduces New Recommendations Feature
data.Description: Google Search Console is rolling out a new feature that provides personalized SEO recommendations. These recommendations, based on data from Search Console, aim to help website owners improve their site's performance in Google Search.

data.Title: Apple Maintains a Large Search Index of Websites
data.Description: Documents from the DOJ's antitrust case against Google reveal that Apple maintains its own search index containing billions of websites, although the exact number remains undisclosed.

data.Title: Google Ads Tests Displaying Advertiser Names in Call Extensions
data.Description: Google Ads is experimenting with a new call extension format that displays the advertiser's name below the clickable phone number. This change aims to increase the visibility of both the phone number and the call-to-action.

data.Title: Google Ads to Show Photos in Local Service Ads, Potentially Boosting Ad Rank
data.Description: Google will now display photos from advertisers' Local Service Ads profiles within their ads. This change is expected to improve ad rank and provide users with a more visually appealing experience.

data.Title: Google Tests Sending Users to Short Videos Tab When Clicking "More Videos"
data.Description: Google is experimenting with redirecting users to the dedicated short videos tab when they click on the "more videos" button in search results, instead of dynamically loading more videos below the initial results.

data.Title: Google Ads Experiences Bug Issuing Million-Dollar Credits
data.Description: Google Ads encountered a bug that resulted in some advertisers receiving credit notices for millions of dollars. The issue has been acknowledged as a bug, and Google is working on rectifying the incorrect credit amounts.

data.Title: Google Search Tests "You May Like" Label for Snippets
data.Description: Google is testing a new "you may like" label for search result snippets. It is unclear how Google determines a user's preference for a particular snippet, potentially using browsing history or other personalization factors.

data.Title: Microsoft Bing Wallpaper App Pushes Users to Switch Browsers
data.Description: Microsoft's Bing Wallpaper app is under scrutiny for allegedly using deceptive tactics to persuade Windows 11 users to switch their default browser to Bing. The app recommends "different browser settings" for faster and more secure searches, raising concerns about misleading users.
